definitions.definition: A person whose body does not decompose after death, a sign of holiness.
One of an ancient religious sect of Alexandria , whose adherents believed that the body of Christ was incorruptible, and that he suffered hunger , thirst , and pain only in appearance.

main_definition: ( Christianity ) A person whose body does not decompose after death, a sign of holiness.
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) One of an ancient religious sect of Alexandria , whose adherents believed that the body of Christ was incorruptible, and that he suffered hunger , thirst , and pain only in appearance.
